byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss contributed reporting from Houston.

abstract: News Analysis; environmentalists and some energy experts suggest that Pres Obama's opening up of Arctic waters for oil and gas drilling could put his environmental legacy at risk; tension between Obama's legacy on environment and energy is evident in that he has pushed for carbon emissions reductions and major global warming accord even as he has overseen vast expansion of domestic energy production.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s move to open up Arctic waters to oil and gas drilling as he pursues an ambitious plan to fight climate change illustrates the tensions in his environmental agenda.

headline.main: Alaska’s Tricky Intersection of Obama’s Energy and Climate Legacies
headline.print_headline: Alaska’s Tricky Intersection of Obama’s Energy and Climate Legacies

snippet: President Obama’s move to open up Arctic waters to oil and gas drilling as he pursues an ambitious plan to fight climate change illustrates the tensions in his environmental agenda.
